name: Men Called Ken Quiz | Name Game | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which Ken was the first elected Mayor of London in the new millennium?
questions.explanation:
Ken Livingstone.

	Nicknamed 'Red Ken', Ken Livingstone is a former Labour leader of the defunct Greater London Council. He was elected in 2000 and re-elected in 2004.

questions.text: This Ken is a British film director, specialising in gritty social realism; what is his surname?
questions.explanation:
Loach.

	His films include "Land and Freedom", "Riff-Raff", "Carla's Song", "Raining Stones" and "My Name is Joe".

questions.text: Ken Morse appears on the credits of very many British TV programmes, in what capacity?
questions.explanation:
Rostrum camera.

	Ken Morse owns his own rostrum camera, a very specialist piece of equipment, which is why he works on so many programmes.

questions.text: This Kenneth was the US government independent counsel leading the investigation of the Lewinsky affair; what was his surname?
Ken Maginnis is a long-serving Northern Ireland politician, of which party (till 2012)?
The actor and director Kenneth Branagh is the ex-husband of which actress?
questions.explanation:
Emma Thompson.

	Branagh left Emma Thompson for Helena Bonham-Carter. Ms Thompson now lives with Greg Wise with whom she has a daughter.

questions.text: Ken Kercheval played one of the leading characters in Dallas; which one?
His greatest successes at club level came in England but Kenny Logan went on to play internationally for which country?
questions.explanation:
Scotland.

	Logan played for the English club, Wasps where he won three English league titles and one European Cup. He won 70 caps for Scotland.

questions.text: Ken Rosewall played in Wimbledon singles finals in both 1954 and 1974.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The Australian tennis star was 40 in 1974 when beaten by Jimmy Connors.

questions.text: Kenneth Williams is best known for starring in which series of films?
questions.explanation:
Carry on.

	Other members of the "Carry On" team included Sid James, Barbara Windsor, Hattie Jacques, June Whitfield, and Charles Hawtree.
